main event: An unidentified object was observed on August 11, 1958, near Rock Springs and Rawlins, Wyoming.
interesting points: The object was described as a round ball-like object measuring 1.5 feet in diameter and having a dull-red color with a red and white tail., The sighting lasted approximately 40 minutes with the object remaining stationary before moving west and disappearing., It was reported by a single witness who telephoned the observation in., The report suggested the possibility of it being a distant aircraft or possibly a meteor., No crashes, bodies, or trace of the object were found.
witness description: a person who telephoned the observation
